title: What can I do if my phone runs slowly?
answer:
Try using **Phone Manager** to optimize your phone:

l   On the home screen, touch **Optimization**.

**Figure 1-1 **

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450839001.gif)

l   On the **Phone Manager** screen, touch **Scan**, and follow the onscreen instructions to optimize your phone.

**Figure 1-2 **

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450299002.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450830003.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450106004.gif)

l   On the **Phone Manager** screen, touch **Phone accelerator**, and follow the onscreen instructions to close applications not in use.

**Figure 1-3 **

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450556005.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450830003.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450475006.gif)

l   On the **Phone Manager** screen, touch **Storage cleaner** > **Smart scan**, and touch **Clean** after the scan.

**Figure 1-4 **

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450126007.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450902008.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111451210009.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450902008.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111451370010.gif)

You can also use the following methods to clear up your phone memory:

l   Close applications not in use.

Go to the **Settings** screen, and touch **Manage apps**. Under **Running**, select the applications you want to close, touch **Stop**, and follow the onscreen instructions.

**Figure 1-5 **

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111451304011.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450902008.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111451577012.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450902008.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111451762013.gif)

l   Clear the application cache.

Go to the **Settings** screen, and touch **Manage apps**. Under **All**, touch **Clear cache**.

**Figure 1-6 **

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111451541014.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450830003.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111451736015.gif)

l   Clear the browser cache and history.

Go to the **Browser** screen, touch ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111451626016.gif)> **Settings** > **Privacy & security**. Then touch **Clear cache** and **Clear history**.

**Figure 1-7 **

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111451962017.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450902008.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111452129018.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111450902008.gif)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20140924111452272019.gif)

l   Restart your phone.

If the problem persists, back up important data and restore your phone to its factory settings.

Note: The figures are for your reference only. Actual screens may vary slightly.
